The breakfast was combination of south Indian snacks some north indian as well as continental items along with fresh fruit juice and tea/coffee. Very good breakfast . Justified the five star rating. There is a shopping mall. along with McDonald's resturent and Domino's Pizza near the hotel. The do provide free WIFI with excellent speed. Overall a great hotel with magnificent rooms best air conditioning in Bengaluru city, well behaved house keeping/room service/polite and ever helpful front desk made my stay memorable. My advice: call the Duty Manager directly for any issues, take only hotel food (quite good and hygienic) , for pick up and drops dial Ola cabs (08033553355) their 24Ã—7 call centre no. With variety of A.C cabs and pocket friendly rates too.âœŒ.A must recommended property.Will stay at this property for my upcoming trips in Bengaluru.

I would recommend this place for people who want to have a peaceful business meeting with a cup of coffee or would want to take their clients for a drink or dinner. The ambience is quiet and serene; soft music will allow you to talk to your associates effortlessly without troubling your throat unlike those many places where itâ€™s impossible to talk amidst loud music.
The seating arrangement is very comfortable that you can spend hours on the couch without torturing your back. A great place for business meetings!

Davanam is one of the best hotels situated in the city centre. All the facilities offered are awesome. The room I got to stay during my previous visit to Bangalore was spacious and luxurious and so was their service.
The swimming pool is the plus point, giving people who stay here a chance to relax peacefully. The serene surroundings and interior decoration can soothe your mind if you are staying here. I highly recommend this place for business trips and conferences.

I work as an Admin head for one of the leading IT companies in Bangalore. A part of my duty is to arrange corporate conferences for my organization. This time, we required a space situated in the heart of the city so that itâ€™s easily accessible. So, I booked Davanam Sarovar.
Itâ€™s a hotel, which is at a fair distance from most of the business houses. The conference room at the 8th floor is really beautiful as it captivated all our guests. The design and interior was really attractive. The conference was conducted in a hassle free manner. The snacks and refreshment prepared by the hotel was really good and satisfied all the corporate delegates. I would like to rate Davanam with 4.5 out of 5 stars for their awesome corporate hospitality.

Last winter, I planned a family vacation to Bangalore. So, my wife booked Davanam following a friendâ€™s suggestion. We were totally 6 people. I would like to thank Davanam staff who allowed us to stay in a single room, which was so spacious that we all comfortably stayed here for a week.
The rooms are highly hygienic and well maintained. Every once in a while, the room service staff used to visit and manage the room as per our requirement. The staffs were very well mannered and I would rate Davanam as one of the best family hotels in Bangalore.

I feel for the owner of the property. He has a great hotel,in a great location but his staff will undo him.
The hotel is at Madiwala,very near to Koramangala,5km from MG Road and has a great location. Only complain would be the lack of parking space and the dirty underground parking shared with the mall in which the hotel is situated. But showing us that dirty underground parking could ve been avoided if the valet did his job. Instead twice he refused to take my car, instead telling me to go and park by myself in their very dirty and dark parking lot. My wife was with me, and I felt threatened by a lot of workers hanging around in the parking lot at 11pm at night when I went to take my car,because the valet refused to take it from there.
Check in was great, not friendly, but fast. They didn't tell me my WiFi password was written on the key card, but I guess they just forgot because it was writ ten. I just had to call them before I found out it was there with me all the while.
I didn't know they actually meant it when they called their hotel Portico Suites. This is the best part. Big huge suits with a Kitchenette with refrigerator, microwave and hotplate, a living room with TV,a bedroom with TV, a huge bathroom and a wardrobe, all for a price of a usual room. This was just great. And neat and well maintains. Great room service too. Food was above average.I ve been to the hotel before for dinner many a times, always lovin the food. But that was spoiled this time by a very poor poor service during the breakfast buffet. I know its a buffer. But there was hardly any customers and yet no one came forward to give me a table or ask me for anything from the live cooking. Even coffee which I asked for after trying ten minutes to grab someones attemtion took a further ten minutes before arriving. I just hated the entire breakfast because of the service. But the food looked good though.
Check out was easy too. No issues. Oh, and WiFi was one of the faster I have experienced in hotels.
Like I said before, the owner loved this hotel, the staff hate him and their jobs, and hence behave really bad.

very good clean and spacious room. Decent location as it is not very far from electronic city. It is in the same building as a mall so you get options to eat on walking distance. Electronic city is also not very far.

It's an awesome place. Superb staff amazing facilities. All the three meals are very tasty.. They take care of their customers very nicely.
Only minus point is it's very difficult to commute since it's in the main city, getting there or from there to some other place is difficult.

Hi, I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights for the business trip. The hotel looks good for me, rooms are clean and neat. But, it is far away from the airport, so air travellers may have to think before book this hotel. Thanks

Sarovar portico was overall a nice hotel. Food was really good. Room was huge and facilities inside worked fine. I personally didn't like the GYM and they hotel could clean it up, with adding some extra mats, towels, water dispenser. Staff were cordial as well. Location and surrounding of the hotel is very very awful!!!!

Suit was very spacious. Good for Senior level Corporates. Very Clean, Prompt service. Staff was very well behaved. Excellent hygiene was maintained in restaurant. Food quality was good. Only drawback is that hotel located bit far from city center. Located in business area though namely Koramangala. Entrance is bit small but hotel is very spacious. Situated on top of the mall so you get variety of food and shopping available downstairs.

stayed for 2 days (7-8 April)

Positive: Huge size rooms with ample space, internal designing, 24 hrs wifi, quick service, awesome food, great stay for 2 days, nice and humble staffs, prime location near silk board, Total mall in same building provides all your needs, beautiful madiwala lake at 10 mins distance, connectivity to all parts of Bangalore as silk board is the prime location of Bangalore, ideal stay for people travelling to chennai and other south indian states as located on main highway,

Negative: poor mobile network connectivity, external ambiance is completely commercial which may or may not please you.

We stayed at the property for a night on a business trip. The property is ideal for people wanting to stay in/having business in south bangalore. The architecture is slightly odd as i guess the hotel is situated on a building which also houses a shopping complex on the lower floors. The hotel itself starts 4th floor onwards i guess. A few of the rooms also overlook the mall lobby.

The check in was smooth. The rooms are spacious with modern decor. Being suites, they also house a cooking area. A microwave and a some very basic crockery was also available. The room was architecturally slightly awkward but nothing wrong as such. I had a good stay and a great nights sleep.

The restaurant was pleasantly surprising. We had dinner buffet and breakfast. Both of which were excellent in terms of spread and quality of food. Dinner buffet priced at Rs. 650+taxes was outstanding and is highly recommended. The spread in terms of cuisines and desserts was brilliant.

Overall a recommended hotel with fairly priced rooms and food.

Nice spacious suits providing facility for Executives & families.Separate sitting area offers comfort of reading . Separated LCD in sitting area and bedroom. The large room are furnished tastefully with optimal usage of 600 sq ft space. The restaurants provides excellent food with large variety to suit every taste bud. The staff is courteous & extremely helpful. Rooftop swimming pool was under repair.

My 2nd stay at this hotel n the experience was beyond words...It just happened that I spent the last 2 birthdays of mine here...they made it even more special with a cake from their end...given a chance to choose any place to stay in bangalore...without any hesitation...this would be it...absolutely love the place...not to far from the city center...extremely hospitable staff..rooms are very spacious and well maintained...their breakfast spread is very diverse and fulfilling...the staff is kind and helpful...thank you for making our stays memorable :)

Among the best modern hotels I've seen recently, keeping the utmost comfort of the traveller in mind. Anything you can think of in a room youâ€™ll probably find it. If not, the polite & courteous staff is ready to help 24x7. Had a very pleasant stay.

Good property, well maintained. Clean rooms, lights in the room were low, no way one can increase the visibility. One can easily skip the reception and has access to all the floors of the hotel.......

The dining experience doesn't just means few good looking sofas/tables/lights. The food and service are two very important criteria for a guest in choosing a restaurant.

The food was OK but I have witnessed a drop in service compared to past few years. In this competitive world you can't afford to loose a customer you should be always on your toes to push the quality higher and higher and keep each customer happy and satisfied.

Hope you guys know your job better than me.

Sarovar Portico is one of the best business hotels I have stayed in Bangalore. The size of the rooms are fantastic, the breakfast and dinner spread is awesome and the service of the staff is too notch. From the exterior it doesn't look too impressive as its attached to a mall next to it, but the impression dramatically changes once you check-into the hotel. It is a value for money hotel. Highly recommended.

I stayed almost one month, and it was very comfortable.
Room is wide and clean, and staff is wonderful.
I could get everything I need at the Total super market.(It is very close to the hotel.)
I also enjoyed Japanese food at FUKUSUKE(4th floor).

Thank you!

Decent stay overall. Food at the restaurant was decent. Service at the restaurant there could have been better I felt. My room was like a studio apartment and lavishly done. Think they had upgraded me

Its on the main road. I stayed in room number 622. Room space is big. Having small kitchen, waiting hall, bedroom and a bath room. Bath room looks very small compared the overall space.
Very much noisy in the night due to facing highway.
Hotel food is good. But some staffs are not customer friendly. During breakfast, they are very rude.
Checkin and checkout is very smooth
Nearby, right side very good malls are located. Leftside big vegetable market located.
When i ask for food plater, shaving/toothbrush kit, immediately provided. I assumed, it must be default, not so.

Bathroom fittings/towels are very old. can be replaced immediately please

Very poor and paranoid staff. When I was checking out I was stopped by the staff at the portico and was asked that I have taken along coffee mugs and glass from the room and was asked to frisk my baggage.

Just next to McDonald and KFC, imagine. What else you need?
This is a best hotel and great value for money.
We stayed there for 5 nights and even after 5 nights, we never wanted to leave our room.
Room, so specious and full of everything. A real suite room.
Staff, very helpful and speaking good English and Hindi both.
Food, was ok. Not many options to choose from but price and in-room service was good.
Location, perfect. Easy to call Uber and can go any corner of the Bangalore.
Room Tariff, I think they are charging less then it should be charged but no complaint.
Cleanliness, this is why I given it a 3 star instead 4. Room was ok clean but bathroom seems outdated and dirty. Towels were very dirty and smelly.

Overall a good experience.

I stayed here on a business trip in Feb 2015 and surprised to see the size and dÃ©cor of room. Looks like living in a furnished flat. Food was fine too. A room to remember. Its an added advantage to have a good mall adjacent to the property. Its nice and big for shopping.

This hotel is really good. Nice and clean rooms and beside a shopping mal containing restaurants and a bar. To advise on all who need to stay in bangalore. Requested an airport pick up, also here perfect service. The best hotel in an acceptable price class I ever had in India

I am a frequent traveller to Bangalore and have been staying in this hotel as my first preference. it has a great Ambience, Great food and the Room service is just to match the taste. the rooms are large and spacious for a single and family

This hotel provides you a great experience in terms of both stay and food. I had an official visit to Bangalore and stayed there for 4 days. the suites come with almost all the facility that you look for in a business hotel. Rooms were spacious and maintained well. you will love to be in the room. Regarding food I must say being a Bengali the taste buds are very sensitive and the hotel does justice to my taste buds. Good variety I must say. the location is also wonderful as your family can spend the entire day in case you are busy with your assignments. Over all "5 star" to Davanam Sarovar Portico!!

Good spacious room and good location . Food is also great. we have stayed a couple of times and we have had a great time . It is also close to a mall which makes things easier. The service could be improved and it would go a long way in keeping customers.

Booked through clear trip as it had some excellent offers. The rooms were so elegant. Feel like home rooms, with two TVs and a kitchen area. Easily accessible place. The complementary breakfast was also good. Good staff. The only problem is with the parking, especially with two Wheeler. I even had to pay for that. Otherwise its a nice place to stay.

The hotel is fantastic as all the rooms are suites. It has big area for small meeting to guest. It has big kitchen and with a refrigerator and oven. The most attractive part was paint on canvas all around the room and hotel.

Restaurant is huge but spread is slightly requires more dishes. Staffs are highly cooporative.

Very good location especially if you are commuting to electronic city for work. Located close to the shopping mail. However the quality of rooms and service was below par compared to other sarovar portico hotels across India. The room layout was strange and hotel staff response was also quite slow. Breakfast quality was also average. Overall I would prefer to stay near main city but recommend it only for short stay and if you are primarily looking to save long commuting time to electronic city.

Stayed for 3 nights on a business trip.
The rooms are very spacious, creatively designed and laid out and very comfy. Most noteworthy is the restaurant. The food quality is awesome. Every preparation we chose was wonderfully prepared and served. We requested some modifications to a few dishes and they were done to perfection. The chefs here are extremely talented.
The service people are very helpful and well mannered.
If I am going Bangalore again, I'll be staying here.

We had a marvelous stay in Davanam Sarovar Portico. Wonderful interiors, very spacious and some excellent dining too, must recommend the hotel's Restaurant for the Starters that they give before the buffet. Very reasonably priced too for a luxury hotel. My only qualm was that we could not stay longer to enjoy the comfort." It is a good hotel . We stayed there many times.

Hello fellow travellers,

I booked this through cleartrip because of some amazing cashback offers around 16th of January. I came here to attend an EDM concert "VH1 Supersonic : Steve Aoki".

They have 3 types of suites to choose from; Regular, Deluxe or Premier. I was staying in Regular suite for 2 days and shifted to another on my last day.

Rooms are big & spacious, Everything a 5 star service apartment offers but just one big room. Starts with a kitchen on the left, a living area with a cozy sofa for 4-people and 2 separate sofas followed by a double bed connected to a beautiful bathroom. Corner wall is a big glass, from where I could see mall from inside.

Service is amazing and one of the key factors why I will recommend someone to stay in this hotel. Bar on the 4th floor is okayish, nothing fancy. Parking was little messed up.

My last day stay wasn't planned as I was looking to either switch hotel or switch the suite in the same hotel as my friends were joining me. I asked the reception to show me the premier suite, which was quite good and big compared to the other room which I was in. I told them I will be taking the Premier suite and asked if they could offer me a better deal than Goibibo, they gave a good offer so I was happy and asked them to shift me. The very night I had the concert, By the time I came back to the hotel, It was late and I realised its not the same room as the one I was shown, so I intimated the reception immediately, they were like "Sir, we can sort it out in the morning". In the morning, I went to checkout and asked them to sort it out which they couldn't. They were telling me it was my issue as I agreed for a deluxe room only which was blatant lie. Why show a premier room when you are giving a deluxe?

Overall stay was good except the last episode.

Regards,
Rusty

The stay at the hotel was really good. The rooms are clean and unusually big at the price. The staff is very prompt and courteous. The food at the restaurant was a bot of a dissapointment. However,a lot of good restaurants are available nearby, which more or less compensate for that.

This hotel is worst hotel i have ever stayed.very difficult checkin (you have to take every member id).then we booked 2 rooms by make my trip for approx 2 months back even than they gave us both rooms at two distant corners.when i requested several times only than they adjacent rooms.now come to order ,i order glass of water in room and despite calling at various places like reception, house keeping and room services they failed to provide even glasses of water.i called all authority but all they are shameless and careless people.plz plz dont stay in this hotel ever.they failed to provide basic amenities like towel,bucket ,mugs.they are such shameless person that they need to be sued

I have always enjoyed staying at most of the Sarovar Hotels across various cities of India, including Davanam Sarovar, Bangalore, but i wasn't too impressed by the quality of food & service in its restaurant. During my recent visit, i really loved it, and now i've become a regular customer, and do most of my business meets @ Tangerine :)

By the way, they serve some awesome Japanese cuisines too, and apart from Shiro @ UB City, i didn't find them elsewhere. Definitely worth giving a try!

A very comfortable first night for us in India. Good room with enough local atmosphere but still reasonably quiet and nearby supermarket very handy. Food was very good and international available for those not wanting local fare.

The location may not be perfect but suited us as we had to commute to electronic city each day and also be in the city area. It forms a part of a mall. The suits are very comfortable, spacious and well furnished. The breakfast spread is more than adequate and has enough variety. The same cannot be said of the in room dinning menu and every thing in it is spicy. Over all a nice place to stay.

We had great time and very good staff.Friendly service.we stayed as a family with 2young kids.It was very comfortable.The staff in the Restaurant was brilliant.Food was very nice.my charger wasn't working,the room service guy organised immediately.

This is a new property and the teerhing problems were seen across depts. The rooms are huge but dimly lit offering low utility value of all the space. Service standards were way below average, food is also not that great though there was ample variety Veg options were limited. For the same price there are better options in city and better locations...

This seems to be new hotel, location is great, they have also got good parking space. Room size in enormous. Breakfast was nice. Concierge services was good, the lady at the concierge really did provide all the help required. Same cannot be said about the reception.

Beautiful hotel, one of the best suites i might have ever stayed..worth for the money..they have a awesome bar and the breakfast got lot of good choices..i enjoyed my stay..awesome suites at a very reasonable price through online bookings.

Rooms are clean and spacious.

Food is average and choice is standard.

Price wise this hotel is far more expensive as the hotel and amenities are standard.

The only thing that one can say positively is that the rooms are large! Staff are attentive but distant and one does not get the feeling that one is welcome.

I stayed for 5 nights during my business visit to Bangalore, India.
Rooms are spacious and clean as you would expect for the price you are paying. Support staff is excellent and always willing to provide their best. Fruit basket on arrival and Spa facilities are not available although it says so while online booking. Hotel information such as swimming pool, Gym was not available in the room. I had to ask reception. Overall, it was good. However, I am sure at this price there are better options available in Bangalore such as Lemon Tree in Electronic City.

We had a business dinner at this property. The place is very good and an xcellent ambient. Food was also very tasty. They have an xcellent buffet and had good varieties or options to choose food from. Highly recommended place for dinner.

Davanam Sarovar Suites is a little away from Central part of Bangalore, but offers an elegant property, complemented by a professional sales and support staff. The property is low on offering any significant pass time alternatives for a business traveler. Quality of food at the restaurant is quite nice. I've been a repeat customer to the Hotel and will continue to be.

The rooms are HUGE and can easily accomdate 2 adults and 2 kids with one extra bed. housekeeping is amazing and so is the breakfast buffet. if u feel like, KFC and Mc Donalds are just right behind in Total mall. also try lunch buffet in metro rail restaurant @rs 450 per person,which is also situated in total mall. wifi is very fast. takes about 90 mins to reach from airport in moderate traffic. overall a Bang for ur Buck.

The corridors of the Davanam Sarovar Portico are long, dark and a bit gloomy and so are the rooms. The carpets in the aisle were soaked with a leak from the air-conditioning system. However, the location is central for that part of Bangalore but the Madiwala market next door is a bit of a nuisance. I stayed there for 4 days in June on a family trip and found the place very convenient for navigating around the southern suburbs. The food at the in-house restaurant was good though the place was teeming with US company staff carrying out walk-in interviews. The hotel obviously has too many rooms and too much traffic for its staff strength and infrastructure.

For the first time I stayed in a Suite Room in a 4 star Category Hotel . Amazingly Beautiful & Luxurious is the words that I can use for the rooms which this Hotel Provides . Earlier I had seen such kind of rooms in Mariott But I never expected such Rooms to be part of Sarovar in their entire Hotel .

My Heartfelt thanks to the sarovar Team for the wonderful maintenance of the rooms & the Hospitality extended to me during my stay for 2 days . Its a Must stay for People visiting Bangalore & Guest who need to be Pampered with the Spacious Room they can imagine

Stay for atleast Once here & I am sure you will be saying the word Thank YOU to the Hotel Management . Food was Good & the service was worth mentioning .

In Restaurent -- Prabhagar & Mohan gave a good service & Anil sir at the Front Desk was very Helpful .

Thanks once again .......

Rooms are Very good and excellent extra large rooms. You really get the suites feel.
The only disappointement is hotel website says swimming pool and fruit platter in room on arrival which they dont give neither the pool is in operational. pool is under constructions. Further housekeeping services are not prompt you have to really call them againa and again to remind. rgrds

Davanam Sarovar Portico Suites provided the best service and facilities that made our stay a memorable one. The location was very apt for shopping and traveling. The complimentary breakfast provided was really good and i would certainly recommend this for my friends and family.

Hotel is located at busy junction and part of the Total mall near Silk Board.

Commute from airport take @ 1.15 mins with light traffic.

About stay
> The service is good and they seem willing and enthusiastic to help their customers which is good.
> The rooms are spacious and clean, the washroom are practical and they work as expected.
> Bed is comfortable
> One thing in notice and which was a big positive was that AC is on when you are away hence the rooms dont stink when you walk in or you dont have to sweat once you return from your work. This I think was a big positive.
> Rooms have hathway cable and hence you can pretty much catch on most of your fav. channels.
> Wi-Fi is realiable and speed decent to help you conduct your business effectively
> The food is good
> They take great care when you are their repeat customer which is a very nice gesture, i got updgraded and room had a small kitchen are
> Some rooms have kitchen with hot plate and Microwave, hence those who like to eath their own food or have senstive stomach this is a big positive, you can get ready to eat from the mall next door or buy vegetables from market just outside the hotel


Things that can improve
> No waste bin in room, you have to go to washroom all the way, not sure why ?
> Soap, it would be nice to have automatic dispensers with quality soap used
> Iron and Ironing board in all rooms is a must in business hotels
> Safety latches do not always work (it did not work for 506), this can be a small issue but good to address

Overall an extremely good hotel and VFM and definetely would continue to stay for my future travels as well.

Its a great property. Had a comfortable stay. staff were friendly and helpful. hotel cabs had very limited service and very expensive too. rooms very clean. don't expect a view from the room. overall good experience.

We had 2 group stay with this hotel. Staff is very co operati5 & Attentive. Nice lobby. Xellent dining & bar. Big big rooms with little pantry. Having facility of microwave & tea/coffee maker. Good linen. 2 lads. All suit rooms. Felt very secure. Excellent food varieties. In short it was memorable experience.

Suite Room 631 given to us could have been much better and view was not good with small window pointing at the inside of a mall...No welcome drinks ir fruits in the room were provided.Booking was for 3 adults and one child still extra bed was provided only after strong request and they said that cleartrip had not informed??? Breakfast eas decent.

Being located at the busiest location, you can not expect calm. But once you enter the hotel you forget outside world. Calm & soothing environment. Food is excellent. Free Wi-Fi and geam is appealing.

Beautiful property , Very large Suites and very beautifully done room . Excellent room service and Food , Very nice location. Almost in the heart of city in Kormangla .Comfortable beds . The wifi is fine. Not very fast nor very slow. Check in took approx. 4-5 min. and checkout almost 3 min.

I would love to stay here again .

We took 3 rooms and they all were excellent and value for money. Room no. 606 is amazing . Location is also good but a bit congested. Very nice stay and hotel. I would recommend to others. Value for money .

perhaps expected a lot from the previous feedback Felt more like a service apartment rather than a hotel. had to wait a lot to get the rooms in a same floor. must admit the great buffet breakfast. also liked their buffet dinner too. swimming pool was dirty and not ready for use.

1. Value for money
2. Good choices in Menu (especially Veg)
3. in heart of city and thus traffic woes
4. Spacious and well designed
5. Overall worth staying
6. Only issue is location - all other worth visiting places are far away

Good and supportive Staff. Total shopping mall provides quick shopping comfort.

My only suggestion - please work on the food menu! The food variety and quality did not live up to the standards of the stay in rooms. Bringing food variety like that of say an example of Chutney Chang in Museum Road should be more beneficial to visitors!

Though I reported that there was no satellite channel/set top box for one of the TV's in my room (606) on day 1 - I was told someone from housekeeping would be sent to check it - but no one followed up. I too forgot about it conveniently. So there needs some improvement here.

I was there for 3 nights with my family (Deluxe suite) . The hotel is very good, also the breakfast (While in Bangalore - we had the rest of meals outside). A perfect spot for an overdue get-together with 2 of my friends. got a room on the 6th floor, facing the mall. This could be a privacy issue if you are traveling as a couple, but the heavy curtains should take care of it, I guess, if lighting is not a concern.
Good ambiance, well appointed executive suite, responsive staff, quality sleep, and a clean neat and tidy in every aspect. The breakfast menu was repetitive, but was of very good quality & diversity. Stayed for 2 days and nights, and will definitely go again, or recommend to anyone. Located on Hosur Road, as part of the Mall, which makes it close to prominent areas like Forum, and koramangala & HSR, but the entrance to the hotel is on the other side of the mall.
Top Notch... I'll Be Back!! hehe... Keep it up guys! Sarovar has lived up to its name!
Cheers!

This hotel is well -kept well -appointed staff . From start to end I had an excellent stay.

It's a lovely hotel in koramangla. Being suite hotel the rooms are nice and spacious ... This is above Total Mall so anything that need is a stroll away. In house restaurant excellent and you have a choice of KFC and Mc Donald inside Total Mall. Forum mall is only 10 mins away soo u are well covered on entertainment too.

It's an excellent pick for the price they charge... Highly recommended

Some of the qualities I admired most about Davanam Portico Suites Hotel is the excellent and friendly staff. The way they greet you when you arrive make you feel welcome. They have a great team.Great food.Creative chefs.I truly enjoyed my trip.Make this your next vacation destination. I'm already planning my next vacation.

This is the Best Hotel/suites I have stayed in Bangalore. "Best Value for Money". The property is very good but what I like about this suite is the Service. Very hospitable, helpful and extremely professional - right from front office guys to GM. I would rate this Suites as "A+" and would always stay in this suite when I go back to Bangalore. A memorable visit...spacious well kept room. Excellent creative work by chefs, especially the new Japanese cuisine. Great team... and attended to every moment of our stay. a must visit place if you expect to experience hospitality at its true sense.

The suites are excellent, every detail in the amenities and the luxury had been attended to. great food. its affordable, had a pleasent stay... would love to visit this property again...affordable luxury pampers you hereâ€

the suites are excellent, every detail in the amenities and the luxury had been attended to. great food. Spacious suites with well appointed living area and kitchenette...but small and tight bed room ...the window opens to the atrium of the ground floor mall...breakfast buffet was elaborate... efficient House keeping and restaurant staff ...but bad experience while checking out....Front Office kept us waiting for 20 minutes....God knows why...three different persons, including a lady were involved...still such avoidable delay....even though they were alerted earlier to keep the bills ready...obviously they were new and lacked expertise in check out process.... communication was also poor.... not expected from a Sarovar hotel.

The hotel is very close to Silk Board and thus very convenient for business travelers. The suite we booked was spacious with a big living room and kitchenette, however, the room was really small. The bed was crammed in a corner such that one needed to climb the bed to go to the far end side, with the TV sticking out in between! Internet, TV, aircon, hot water, etc worked well.

Breakfast is mostly an Indian spread, and not suitable for visitors from abroad. The waiters are most helpful but the food was mostly luke-warm/cold. The front desk really needs improvement. Check-in as well as check-out takes a long time. If you do not check your bills, chances are you will be charged for things you have already paid for. The front desk staff need training in hospitality, they never smile or greet and are almost unhelpful. They look confused when asked simple questions.

To sum, it can be a good hotel for its spacious rooms and location if staff present themselves better.

Arrived at an odd hour (3:00 AM); once I was able to find the reception on the 4th floor it went smooth. The suites are very spacious and well equipped which make your stay comfortable.

The A/C was working very good kept the room nice and cold. As others have mentioned, the rooms are a little dark & challenging to understand the lighting system since there are numerous switches. My main observation in regards to the rooms is, if you have two TVs both should be functioning with cable service. Out of the two TVs in my room only one was working, the TV which was in front of my bed didn't have a signal.. I was told that I could request in reception for them to bring up a second cable box, that the practice was to have only one. Then why have two TVs??

I found that the breakfast buffet was limited and what I did try my first day was not so tasty, to the point that I skipped it for the rest of my stay. Unfortunately for the dinner service I cant say much as the hotel restaurant had a private event and was fully booked. Had to have dinner at the mall next door.

As I had an early flight, the night before my checking out I had asked the reception to have my bill ready early in the morning to assure no delays; even though they had confirmed that it would be ready at the agreed time; when I went down to check-out I had to wait approximately 20 minutes to have my bill for food & drinks as the room was pre-paid.

If possible, arrange your own airport transfer to the hotel, the service provided to me was below standard, the car was not the greatest, the driver didn't speak a word of English and what made it worst was the price almost double; so if you are going to get bad service and dodgy car better get it on your own for half the price..

My family and I had two rooms at Davanam for three days. Although we had a rocky start, our stay was very comfortable. While checking in, the receptionist questioned my Indian visa stamped on my U.S. passport. He retained my passport to show it to his supervisor. Who knew that a hotel receptionist would double as an Indian immigration agent! I was ready to storm out, however, as we were late for an outside function, we checked in. Except for this initial problem, everything else was very good. One of our rooms was upgraded. Suites are modern, spacious, clean, and practical. Lighting was a bit too dim. The almost transparent glass door from the bathroom to the dressing area creates somewhat of a privacy issue, especially if you are sharing the bedroom with a non-spouse. The fourth floor reception was different from the usual. Parking was rather difficult. On the positive side, the restaurant was excellent. The breakfast buffet was elaborate. The service was excellent. Overall, I would recommend this hotel.

Message to the hotel - Trust the Indian immigration officers to do their jobs! You are not immigration! Do not make your guests feel unwelcome by questioning their visas.

I arrived at this hotel on 25th June evening, and checked out on 27th June morning.

The hotel reception is on the 4th floor. The hotel is part of the Total Superstore mall at Madiwala in Bangalore.

Check in: The check in was very efficient. I was allocated a room on the 5th floor (532). The bell boy escorted me to the room. The corridor leading to the room was well carpeted and hence very quite.

The Suite: The suite is like a studio apartment. At the entry, there is a kitchenette with a couple of chairs for dining. There is also a sofa set for relaxing. The bedroom has a large bed. My only grouse is the lighting in the dressing area. It is too dark and the lights are not placed over the dressing mirror to see anything. Also the dÃ©cor is very dark and so there is no brightness. You have to invariably open the curtain to light up the room, but that window overlooks the upper floors of the mall. Not a very good idea!

Breakfast/Dinner: It is served in the restaurant on the 4th floor. The spread is good with couple of continental dishes, a few Indian dishes and the usual stuff.

Business Services: I was conducting a workshop there for 2 days, and the only complaint I have is that the power supply kept going off on day 2 repeatedly. I asked for UPS power to the projector but it was provided only at 4 PM on day 2, just 2 hrs before closing.

Special Mention: Mr. Prasoon who was assigned to us as the coordinator took very good care of all our requirements. The breaks happened at the stipulated time. During lunch also, he was there to ensure our needs were taken care of! Good job done, Prasoon!

Overall Impression: Very good suite, good business services, if only they could get the lighting in the bedroom arranged, it would be 5 stars!

This is my regular hotel on trips to Bangalore. Beautiful rooms and quality service. Food is good as well.
The entrance and lobby are a let down but only hides the better parts.
Especially want to congratulate Sarovar on the good service, this is the third sarovar property I have been to and it has consistently been good

I stayed here on two separate occasions and found the experience very satisfying.Rooms are spacious and clean.The reception was manned by very efficient lady who seemed to be over worked. The WIFI was very good . The breakfast buffet spread was excellent. The lunch buffet albeit being on the costlier side was good. 1. The 4 veg and 3 non veg dishes which are prepared and served fresh in the buffet needs to be served quickly and the guests should be briefed about this or the same should be mentioned in the menu card.On the two occasions I and my son opted for the buffet we missed these accompaniments.The waiters themselves were complaining of the delay by the kitchen.

2. More efficient coordination between the front desk and the car rental manager.

This is one of the finest hospitality hotel, With excellent staff at front & Restaurant. I spend 4 days happily. The fast and excellent service amazing... Excellent rooms, excellent service , well connected ... exotic buffet menu and the best part of the hotel is that I can cook in the room .Rooms could be a little brighter.Buffet spread for breakfast is fantastic , they also offer japanese food .Overall a good place to stay ..

Excellent stay overall and great food!

But the parking procedure is very bad and upsetting. Since the hotel has a common basement parking with the Total Mall, the ticket issuers in the basement are being rude to the guests. Later, when I enquired, the concierge said that I could just park for free and made no mention of any hotel pass. However, the ticket issuers in the basement blocked my car even the next day and questioned me on why my car was parked overnight without any pass or parking ticket. This lack of coordination between the hotel and the basement parking attendants has to be looked into seriously.

We stayed here for four days. we had taken two suites for our family of four.The suites are beautiful, very spacious, luxurious, centrally airconditioned, free highspeed WIFI. we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.Mr Ather at the reception desk was very helpful in booking the rooms and was instrumental in providing a free late checkout.

I chose this hotel for my stay as it was closer to my relative's place. Currently, only few floors are functional. However, the size and quality of the rooms takes you by surprise. Never going to stay here again.

The staffs were very friendly and co-operative, guiding me at every point I needed. There was a bit of disturbance from outside noise given the hotel is located right in the center of the cityâ€¦ But it compensates big time with its connectivity to all major IT parks..Large walk-in closets again took me by surprise as I was not expecting something like this in the given budget. Three of us came for a seven night stay. I had enjoyed my stay at Sarovar Portico in Ahmedabad, and I equally enjoy my stay at Davanam Sarovar Portico Suites Bangalore.

I'm still giving it 5 stars, because I didn't really find anything else negative about it, and honestly I've coughed out 6k+ on crappy hotels with PATHETIC service in past, and probably that's why I'm giving 5 stars to Sarovar Portico in relative terms.

If you're staying in Bangalore for a short duration, and have most of your work in city center, then this is probably one of the better picks among hotels in Koramangala, hosur road, and Madivala, but if you need to be only near the airport then probably you should consider the other options.

Based on good reviews from trip advisor, we had booked a premium suite during our stay starting 15th Dec. 2013.

Must say that the property is located in a very strategic place alongside Total Mall in Madivala. On the right side of the property is the huge vegetable market.

Based on the reviews we where really looking forward to our stay in Sarovar. We where awe struck with the size of the rooms (2 bhk with 2 bathrooms, hall, kitchen, study area etc.). It is huge, and getting such a space at this price in a 5 star hotel will be next to impossible.

However our issues started upon checking to the room. a) Upon turning on the tap dirty red water came out from all the taps, b) Air condition for the master bedroom was not working, c) We had difficult connecting to the free wireless internet. It looked like the room was not used for a long time and neither was the room checked by Housekeeping before checking us in, else would their be any valid reason why red dirty water is coming out of the taps.

Finally after several complains when the Air Con just didnâ€™t work, the staff decided to move us to another premium suite and told us to wait for half an hour while they got the suite ready. By then you can imagine our frustration, wherein we have 2 children, comprising of a small infant, not able to use the bathrooms after a long flight journey from another state.

Finally we were shifted to another Premium Suite which comparatively was much better then the previous one, although the bathroom tiles, and various places in the rooms were filled with dust.

The bathroom fittings were rusted in few places, and made us wonder as to why such a nice property was being treated so badly.

Then started our trauma of FREE wireless internet. While the staff tried their best to help us to connect to connect multiple device to the net via a router, however due to there poor internet connections, we faced connectivity issues every single time.

Moreover once again we faced issues with the AC not working and where told the chiller is being restarted and within 15 mins the AC will be cooling.

Amenities promised such as induction plate, microwave oven was not kept in the room and was placed only upon request. (Even then availability was not confirmed and they stated they will confirm back) Made me wonder why was the same being advertised as a standard amenity.

The breakfast buffet was good and so was the food quality in the in-room dining. They do have infant menu as well.

With regards to the Airport transfer that we had booked and paid for separately when we called up the front desk to re-confirm our drop to the Airport, he mentioned that the Airport transfer has been arranged and it is a complimentary service. We inturn had to remind him that we have paid for the Airport transfer since we preferred a bigger car for our number of suitcases and was not a complimentary service.

This made us wonder if the front desk is actually looking at the guest reservation details before expressing such statements.

During our check-out we happened to met with the Manager and informed him about the issues with the AC and the Internet that we had faced during our stay, and he did mention that they are shortly planning to migrate to another internet service provider as they are facing lot of issues with the current one. However he himself was shocked when he heard about the Air Con malfunctioning issues and the red water tap issues and did apologies for the same.

However we where saddened to see that such a nice property is not being maintained well, and if it goes at this rate soon the place will look worn out. The Sarovar team needs to put in additional efforts to ensure the property is brought up to mark with other star hotels as they have a gem of a property in a wonderful location.

The window in our suite was over looking the central court of a mall. But the comfortable room more then made up for lack of view.

The staff were very friendly and helpful. The restaurant/bar had good a good ambience but was slightly expensive.

This is fairly new property.For the money I paid roughly $90 a night then I'd say it is quite good.If on the other hand you need a top notch 5 star hotel then this us not it.The hotel rooms are all suites with full kitchen ,living room ,bedroom,large walk in closet and good sized bathroom.I had the basic deluxe suite and room was fine for the money.On arrival my room had no internet router and so I had no internet.It took the staff at great from me telling them I would check out to finally get a router set up in my room.The hotel bills itself as having free internet throughout but this us not true if you are an international traveler using your home mobile service on roaming as I do.If you have an Indian mobile number then they get you on an Airtel plan but it is a drill.Free open wifi are as international traveler knows is not what is available here.So I had good wifi in my room once they set up the router but I did not gave any wifi anywhere else.The staff is very eager to please and really there is no complaint about the very friendly service.The property is big but the the quality of the construction ,finishing,carpeting,flooring reminded on Indian hotel of the 80's. Again for the money it us very acceptable but had they paid attention to construction details they could easily have made this a top notch property. The bathrooms are very basic but with a good overhead shower.You get one bar of soap and one small tiny shampoo,no face cloths,no hand towels a bathrobe that will fit a petite woman that weighs 50 kgs and that is it.They could seriously improve this.We all want to save the environment but to give 2 full size towels instead of different sizes is not being Eco friendly.You wash your hands and you need to use a full size towel. This is a boutique hotel on the 4th to 8th floors in a mall. It has an unassuming front with a small entrance leading to the lifts witha a small cocierge and seating area. The recption lounge is on the 4th floor.The check in was swift and pleasant. the room was a pleasant surprise. To one side is the kitchen area with a sink, counters, cabinets and a medium sized fridge. On the other side is a dressing area leading off to a small bed area. There is a shower stall - bo tub. It takes a while for the water in the bathromm to flow hot. The bed has a firm spring mattress. with a very soft ??down quilt and a choices of large but very soft pollows. I slept like a baby all th four nights. There are electrical outlets on all walls and the lighting is soft but bright enough. Though there is a kitchen there are no utensils stove. There is an electric kettle with tea and coffee.
